text.__SUMMARY__: Quercus chapmanii, commonly referred to as the Chapman oak, is a species of oak that grows in the southeastern United States.
text.Description: Quercus chapmanii is a shrub or small tree occasionally reaching a height of 6 meters (20 feet) but usually less. Leaves sometimes have no lobes, sometimes wavy rounded lobes.
text.Distribution: Quercus chapmanii is found in the states of Alabama, Florida, Georgia, and South Carolina.
